lead_paragraph: THERE'S a home test for pregnancy and a drug test kit for parents. Now there's a do-it-yourself test to see if your drink has been spiked with the date-rape drugs GHB or ketamine -- odorless, colorless sedatives that impair judgment and induce sleep. The test, made by Drink Safe Technologies in Plantation, Fla., consists of a four-inch cardboard coaster that fits into a purse or pocket. Students can slip it under their beverage and dribble liquid with a swizzle stick or finger on one of two test areas. If the spot turns blue, the drink has been dosed. The company also makes a personal test kit with 20 strips.

headline.main: Here's One Way to Turn Off a Date

abstract: New do-it-yourself test lets user determine if drink has been spiked with date-rape drugs GHB or ketamine; more than 40 colleges and universities have ordered them for distribution to students; photo (special section, Education Life) (M)
snippet: THERE'S a home test for pregnancy and a drug test kit for parents. Now there's a do-it-yourself test to see if your drink has been spiked with the date-rape drugs GHB or ketamine -- odorless, colorless sedatives that impair judgment and induce sleep....
